intro: Arsenjevia flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid arsenic plant, is a rare and toxic species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant contains various toxic compounds, including arsenic compounds, which make it hazardous to both humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Due to its toxicity, it is not cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
